alert.note: Alert for Pima (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 19 at 12:51PM MST until August 19 at 2:45PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tucson has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Northeastern Pima County in southeastern Arizona... * Until 245 PM MST. * At 1251 PM MST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing between 1.00 and 1.75 inches of heavy rain over Oro Valley. An automated rain gage at the CDO Wash at Big Wash indicated 1.18 inches of rain has fallen from these storms. Law enforcement reported that Hardy road was inundated with water and may be impassible. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Oro Valley, Marana, Casas Adobes, Tortolita, Catalina State Park and Catalina Foothills. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
